page.title: 02The Church of St. Andrew
page.content: St. Andrew's Church is an attractive limestone building set on a raised site and so is a striking feature of the landscape.The churchyard contains several mature yew trees and is approached through a beautiful lichgate.To the west the ground falls away down the cliff and there are views to the Trent Valley over the trees standing in the road leading down to the Stather.The church has been restored at various times but the tower and the south doorway are the original as built 750 years ago.Over a Norman pillar of the north arcade is carved a figure of a monk holding an inverted skull.There is an early 14th century effigy of a knight and the chancel contains various monuments to the Sheffield family of Normanby.
